data.title: Frederick William I of Prussia
data.text:
Frederick William I (Friedrich Wilhelm I; 14 August 1688 – 31 May 1740), known as the Soldier King was King in Prussia and Elector of Brandenburg from 1713 until his death in 1740. He was succeeded by his son, Frederick the Great.

Marriage[edit]

On 28 November 1706, he married Princess Sophia Dorothea of Hanover.

Issue[edit]

Friedrich Ludwig, Crown Prince of Prussia (23 November 1707 - 13 May 1708) died in infancy.

Princess Wilhelmine of Prussia (3 July 1709 – 14 October 1758) married Frederick, Margrave of Brandenburg-Bayreuth and had issue.

Prince Friedrich Wilhelm of Prussia (16 August 1710- 21 July 1711) died in infancy.

Prince Friedrich of Prussia (24 January 1712-

17 August 1786) married Princess Elisabeth Christine of Brunswick-Wolfenbüttel but had no issue.

Princess Charlotte Albertine of Prussia (5 May 1713- 10 June 1714) died in infancy.

Princess Friederike Luise of Prussia (29 August 1714 – 4 February 1784) married Karl Wilhelm Friedrich, Margrave of Brandenburg-Ansbach and had issue.

Princess Philippine Charlotte of Prussia (13 March 1716 – 17 February 1801) married Charles I, Duke of Brunswick-Wolfenbüttel and had issue.

Prince Ludwig Karl of Prussia (2 May 1717- 31 August 1719) died in infancy.

Princess Sophie Dorothea of Prussia 25 January 1719 – 13 November 1765) married Frederick William, Margrave of Brandenburg-Schwedt and had issue.

Princess Luise Ulrike of Prussia (24 July 1720 – 16 July 1782) married Adolf Frederick of Sweden and had issue.

Prince August Wilhelm of Prussia (9 August 1722 – 12 June 1758) married Princess Luise of Brunswick-Wolfenbüttel and had issue.

Princess Anna Amalia of Prussia (9 November 1723 – 30 March 1787) never married.

Prince Heinrich of Prussia (18 January 1726 – 3 August 1802) married Princess Wilhelmine of Hesse-Kassel but had no issue.

Prince August Ferdinand of Prussia (23 May 1730 – 2 May 1813) married Princess Elisabeth Luise of Brandenburg-Schwedt and had issue.

Titles and styles[edit]

14 August 1688 – 25 February 1713 His Royal Highness The Crown Prince of Prussia.

25 February 1713 – 31 May 1740 His Majesty The King.

Frederick William I of Prussia

Born: 14 August 1688 Died: 31 March 1740 Regnal titles Preceded by King in Prussia

Elector of Brandenburg

Prince of Neuchâtel

1713–1740 Succeeded by
